title: Head of Receivables
description:
**About this role:**

Wells Fargo is seeking a Head of Receivables. This leader will define the
product outcomes and strategy, and drive towards the end-state vision. Leads
and aligns cross-functional teams to create exceptional omni-channel
experiences and products with measurable business outcomes and customer
benefits. Responsible for key business and customer metrics as well as the
related processes and policies, including risk and controls.

  
****In this role, you will:****

  * Lead and oversee the Receivables Product Management Team within the Global Treasury Management team.
  * Develop and execute strategic plans to enhance receivables products and services, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and market demands.
  * Drive innovation and product development initiatives to meet evolving customer needs and regulatory requirements.
  * Provide strategic guidance and direction to optimize the performance and profitability of receivables products.
  * Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, risk management, and technology, to deliver integrated solutions.
  * Cultivate and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including clients, partners, and industry professionals.
  * Monitor industry trends, competitive landscape, and market dynamics to identify opportunities for growth and differentiation.
  * Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success and effectiveness of receivables product offerings.
  * Ensure compliance with regulatory standards, policies, and procedures governing treasury banking activities.
  * Mentor and develop team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional growth.

  
****Required Qualifications:****

  * 8+ years of Product Management experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education
  * 4+ years of Management experience

  
****Desired Qualifications:****

  * Bachelor's degree in finance, business administration, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred.
  * Proven experience in treasury banking, with a focus on receivables product management and leadership roles.
  * Strong understanding of financial markets, payment systems, and cash management solutions.
  * Demonstrated track record of driving product innovation, strategic planning, and revenue growth.
  * Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
  * Strategic thinker with the ability to analyze complex issues and develop actionable solutions.
  * Proven leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate teams.

title: Head of Product Sales Specialists
description:
**About this role:**

Wells Fargo is seeking a Head of Product Sales Specialists. We are seeking a
dynamic and experienced leader within the Global Treasury Management
organization to lead our Product Sales Specialist Team. This leader will play
a crucial role in driving revenue growth, fostering client relationships, and
guiding the team to deliver exceptional expertise on detailed product
functionality to aide the expansion of both existing and new client
relationships within Global Treasury Management.

  
****In this role, you will:****

  * Lead, motivate, and manage a team of Product Sales Specialists, providing guidance and support to achieve sales targets and business objectives.
  * Develop and execute strategic sales plans to drive revenue growth and market expansion in line with company goals.
  * In partnership with the Global Treasury Management sales organization, cultivate and maintain strong relationships with existing clients, while also identifying and pursuing new business opportunities.
  * Cultivate and grow a team of deep product subject matter experts that understand the technical intersection between treasury products and accounting/ERP systems.
  * Understand the fundamentals of corporate treasury management and guide the product solutioning for clients in collaboration with sales and product management teams.
  * Develop thought leadership materials and content that address known and emerging industry pain points and areas for optimization or improvement.
  * Collaborate with internal stakeholders, including product development, marketing, and operations teams, to enhance product offerings and address client needs effectively.
  * Stay abreast of industry trends, regulatory changes, and competitor activities to inform strategic decision-making and maintain a competitive edge.
  * Provide regular performance evaluations, coaching, and professional development opportunities for team members to foster a culture of continuous improvement.
  * Ensure compliance with relevant laws, regulations, and internal policies to uphold ethical standards and mitigate risk within the sales function.
  * Represent the company at industry events, conferences, and client meetings to promote our brand and enhance our reputation as a trusted advisor in treasury banking.

  
****Required Qualifications:****

  * 8+ years of Product Management experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education
  * 4+ years of Management experience

  
****Desired Qualifications:****

  * Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business Administration, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred.
  * Certified Treasury Professional designation a plus
  * Proven track record of success in sales leadership roles within the financial services industry, with a focus on treasury banking products and services.
  * Strong understanding of treasury banking products, including cash management, liquidity management, trade finance, and risk management solutions.
  * Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and credibility with clients at all levels.
  * Strategic thinker with the ability to analyze market trends, identify opportunities, and develop actionable plans to drive business growth.
  * Leadership experience, with the ability to inspire and motivate a high-performing team to achieve exceptional results.
  * Demonstrated ability to navigate complex organizational structures and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
  * Sound judgment and decision-making skills, with a commitment to upholding ethical standards and regulatory compliance.

title: Lead Software Engineer-Site Reliability Engineer
description:
**About the Role**  
We are looking for an SRE who enjoys and thrives on solving complex problems
through innovation impacting change at scale. You will join an elite team of
SREs driving technology's transformation by introducing enterprise
capabilities and products, automating away complex issues , launching new
platforms, building tools, , and integrate with the latest technology. Site
Reliability Engineers leverage their experience as software and systems
engineers to ensure applications are available, have full stack observability,
introduce continuous improvement through code and automation, provide
operational insight through analytics, continuously test, are integrated with
CI/D and work with application teams to ensure products and service we provide
are always on.  
  
**Responsibilities:**  

  * Instantiate Site Reliability Engineering practice at Wells Fargo igniting the practice, principles, and culture leading by example.
  * Responsible for developing SRE framework across the technology suite of applications and Infrastructure with full stack development skillsets (front-end, back-end and database),
  * Proficient in Machine Learning and Automation Skillset to analyze the data (Incident, Change, Problem) to identify automation opportunities.
  * Drive Observability best practices when setting up, monitoring, and alerting on the Service Level Objective ("SLO") threshold.
  * Identify the major incident patterns that are either P1/P2 or P3 customer impacting and implement Predictive Failure Analytics via Machine Learning (ML) to proactively identify patterns of failure and address the issue to avoid a major incident.
  * Design self- healing resiliency patterns to improve the reliability of the environment / applications by establishing sustainable controls around the failure patterns
  * Explore and implement use cases of AI in operation management to drive modernizing the operation (ModOps) culture at the firm
  * Implements infrastructure, configuration, and infrastructure as code for the platforms in your remit
  * Understands service level indicators and utilizes service level objectives to proactively resolve issues before they impact customers.
  * Supports the adoption of site reliability engineering best practices within your team.
  * Introduce enterprise capabilities, tools, and innovation improving availability in a multi-cloud ecosystem by evolving observability, monitoring, logging, CI/CD integration, continuous testing (performance, smoke, regression, functional, chaos) introduce continuous improvement, standardization/automation, capabilities to conduct destructive and resiliency testing 
  * Automate key SRE metrics and IT Service Operations processes including customer impact, % availability of critical business flows, SLO/SLI adherence, error budget, automate incident process for IT Service Operations through data integrating with unified communications, alerting/notification systems, and evolve ChatOps to reduce time to recovery. 
  * Share support responsibilities for critical applications and customer journeys onboarded to SRE including remediation of issues through Agile, conduct blameless post mortems, root cause analysis and introduce continuous improvement solving problems once and for all with the goal of no repeats.

**Required Qualifications** :

  * 8+ years of Software Engineering experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education
  * Proven Technical Expertise with one or more of the following:
    * Software Development: Java, Go, C/C++, Scala, Python, SQL
    * OS and Platform - AWS, Lamda, PCF, Kubernetes, OpenShift, Linux, Azure, Windows, Vmware
    * CI/CD and Automation: Jenkins, Gitlab, SonarQube, Artifactory, Ansible, Puppet, Apigee

title: Cloud Lead Specialty Software Engineer
description:
**About this role:**

Wells Fargo is seeking a seasoned Cloud Lead Specialty Software Engineer to be
a corner stone of our Engineering enablement division within Consumer
Technology (CT) team. This critical role is centered on crafting and advancing
our banks hybrid and multi-cloud framework. Learn more about the career areas
and business divisions at wellsfargojobs.com.

Our ideal candidate is one who harbors a deep enthusiasm for the realm of
cloud computing and derives satisfaction from resolving our clientele's
complex business issues. If your drive is fueled by collaborative innovation
and the allure of significant challenges, you are likely to find fulfilling
career with our team.

****In this role, you will:****

  * Provide expert level guidance on Cloud migration and modernization decisions, standards, and day 2 operational practices.

  * Maintain thought leadership role in cloud technology, remaining up to date on offerings of various cloud service providers.

  * Responsible for the overall architecture of Hybrid cloud migrations across CT portfolio of apps

  * Be an active member of CT Cloud center of excellence to define and govern best practices in Cloud platforms engineering, cloud operations, governance. 

  * Plan and implement the selection of new cloud services and tools to enable cloud roadmap by conducting proof of concepts.

  * Understand Cloud blueprints and reference implementations of cloud products and advice product engineering teams.

  * Partner with technology controls and security teams to engineer secure app patterns and ensure all regulatory requirements are met.

  * Work with teams to provide guidance on cloud platforms and escalate risks and issues as appropriate.

  * Communicate problems and challenges to drive discussions across key stakeholders – product engineering, platform operations, CTO teams, and executives.

**Required Skills:**

  * 5+ years of Specialty Software Engineering experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education

  * 3 years’ experience in delivering large scale distributed applications in Hybrid cloud platforms such as Cloud Foundry, Azure, and Google Cloud with focus on performance, scale, security, and reliability

  * Azure and/or Cloud Foundry Solution Architect Certification

  * 3+ years' experience in web and desktop applications developed in Java and .NET frameworks

  * 2 years' experience in troubleshooting and performance management using Splunk, Prometheus, etc.

  * 3 years' experience in Agile development practices and test-driven development

**Desired Skills:**

  * 2 years' experience with infra-as-code, policy-as-code, etc. with technologies such as Terraform, Sentinel policy frameworks

  * 3 years' experience with DevOps and CICD tools such as Jenkins, Urban Code, Harness, and Helm

  * Experience in container technologies such as Kubernetes

**Job Expectations:**

title: Lead Systems Operations Process Engineer
description:
Responsible for conceptualizing and advancing the creation and cohesion of new
tools, processes, models, and technologies to optimize IT service management
processes, ensuring efficiency, and implementing improvements toward
operational excellence.  Success in this role will require process engineering
expertise, technical competency, analytical and critical thinking, and
communication skills, along with the ability to drive to results.

**In this role, you will:**

  * Conduct thorough analysis of existing ITSM processes to identify inefficiencies and areas for improvement
  * Develop and implement strategies to optimize production processes, improve operational reliability, and enhance overall efficiency
  * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather data, conduct experiments, and implement solutions that align with organizational goals.
  * Design and implement process improvements, including the use of new technologies, methodologies, and algorithms
  * Monitor and evaluate process performance metrics and KPIs to ensure continuous improvement and compliance with industry ITSM standards
  * Support production teams through RCA analysis and implementation of correctional actions
  * Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices to drive innovation for preventing, detecting, and responding to factors affecting system availability
  * Develop and maintain documentation for designs, processes, models, procedures, and guidelines
  * Train and mentor team members on process optimization and improvement methodologies

**Required Qualifications:**

  * 5+ years of Systems Engineering, Systems Analysis, Technology Architecture, Process Engineering, or equivalent experience demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, and education

**Desired Qualifications:**

  * Experience writing pseudocode and prototyping solutions in an enterprise environment
  * Demonstrable experience with Business Process Design, Process Modelling, Service modelling & current & target operating models in the IT department
  * Proficient in AI/ML modelling and algorithms with a command of clustering, regression, and classification use cases
  * Familiar with statistical analysis, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education
  * Exposure to process modelling techniques and standard notations like BPMN, UML, EPC, etc
  * Hands on experience with modelling tools
  * Should be well versed with process improvement techniques like Lean, Six Sigma etc
  * Experience with Risk Identification Techniques like root cause analysis will be an added advantage
  * Strong communication & collaboration skills to drive meetings with numerous stakeholders to achieve outcomes

**Job Expectations:**

  * Looking for process engineers with relevant experience on driving process improvements, process re-engineering using BPM and business modelling methodology
  * The ideal candidate should have exposure using clean slate approach to understand current state of the business and process, create future states by identifying opportunities to improve business processes, risks and control gaps
  * The role will require collaboration with multiple stakeholders to create high level and decomposed states of the processes, process attributes like metrics, KPI’s, KRI’s etc
  * Use process engineering hat to suggest process changes, improvements, and measures to mitigate risk and control gaps

title: Senior Human Resource Business Partner- Commercial Banking
description:
**­­About this role:**

Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior Human Resources Business Partner to join the
Commercial Banking (CB) Human Resources team. This highly collaborative and
influential position will operate as a liaison to assist with the design and
implementation of human capital strategies in support of specific business
initiatives with CB leaders. Furthermore, the Sr. HRBP will partner with peers
and other members of the team for completion of cross-functional, enterprise
Human Resources initiatives.

The Senior Human Resources Business Partner (Sr. HRBP) will be a key
participant in strategic conversations with leaders within the Commercial
Banking division to align Human Resources priorities with client needs;
including but not limited to Total Rewards, Talent Acquisition, Diversity,
Equity, Representation & Inclusion, Performance & Talent Management and
Organizational Effectiveness.

For additional information on the Human Resources and Commercial Banking lines
of business, refer to the external Careers Site at
[www.wellsfargojobs.com](http://www.wellsfargojobs.com/).

  
**In this role, you will:**

  * Lead moderately complex initiatives and deliverables and contribute to large scale planning related to Human Resources Consulting deliverables that positively impact the transformation of the Commercial Banking businesses
  * Review and analyze moderately complex business challenges that require an in-depth evaluation of multiple factors, and provide potential solutions while managing change and mitigating risk
  * Collaborate and partner closely with designated Human Resources Center of Excellence Partners for execution of cross-functional initiatives, including but not limited to Total Rewards, Talent and Performance Management and Talent Acquisition.
  * Create and present relevant information, data analyses and visualizations to stakeholders and senior leaders in alignment with project and initiative management objectives and deliverables
  * Drive the effective and efficient delivery of HR specialized services/support to ensure leadership receives the appropriate support to solve human capital issues
  * Advise business leaders leveraging business, organizational and cultural knowledge, and data and analytics to develop and implement human resources solutions
  * Resolve moderately complex issues to meet project deliverables while applying knowledge of Wells Fargo HR policies, procedures, and compliance requirements
  * Embrace the Wells Fargo Human Resources Operating Model by proactively and effectively collaborating with partners to positively influence outcomes

**Required Qualifications**

  * 4+ years of Human Resources Advisory or Human Resource Business Partner experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education

**Desired Qualifications**

  * Demonstrated knowledge and application of various human-centric concepts in a consistent and compliant manner
  * Ability to work effectively in a team environment with geographically dispersed partners, clients, and peers.
  * Ability to navigate complexities to drive outcomes in a heavily regulated and compliance-driven organization.
  * Experience developing partnerships and collaborating with other business and functional areas in a global, matrixed organization
  * Familiarity with supporting large, diverse populations of employees at all levels of the organization
  * Experience in several of the following HR disciplines:  talent development, talent management, compensation, recognition, performance management, diversity equity & inclusion, employee relations, team member engagement and retention, organizational design/development, executive coaching, human capital planning or staffing and recruiting
  * Diversity equity and inclusion consulting experience
  * Demonstration of resilience and leadership through times of ambiguity and change
  * Ability to interact with integrity and a high level of professionalism with all levels of team members and management
  * Ability to assess issues, make quick decisions, implement solutions, and influence change in alignment with organizational goals and client objectives
  * Ability to strategically analyze data and diagnose opportunities and interventions
  * Ability to execute in a fast paced, high demand, environment while balancing multiple priorities and maintaining awareness of risk mitigation
  * Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
  * Experience working in a matrix environment:  delegation of activities to appropriate owner of work, especially members of the broader HR Centers of Excellence (HR COE)
  * Experience providing consult and presenting solutions to senior leadership and demonstration of considering and accepting feedback from partners
  * Professional presentation skills

**Job Expectations:**

  * This position offers a hybrid work schedule (minimum 3 days per week onsite) in one of the locations listed below.
  * Relocation assistance is not available for this position.
  * Visa Sponsorship not available for this position

**Preferred Locations:**

  * 401 S. Tryon Street, - Charlotte, NC, 28282
  * 1445 Ross Ave., Dallas, TX, 75202

title: Principal Architect, Consumer Payments
description:
**About this role:**

Wells Fargo is seeking a Principal Architect (Principal Engineer) in Consumer
Payment Management as part of Consumer Technology.  Learn more about the
career areas and lines of business at
[wellsfargojobs.com](https://www.wellsfargojobs.com/career-areas/).

This senior technical professional within the Consumer Technology organization
is responsible for**Customer Payment Management Architecture (L4)** and the
associated business-technology strategies.

This role is a key liaison with internal teams such as financial product
development, operations, marketing, digital product development, design,
technology, legal, risk and compliance. Experience in Digital Payments, Cloud,
Data, DevSecOps, Domain Driven Design, Archimate, Architecture Frameworks
(TOGAF) is foundational to the role.

  
****In this role, you will:****

  * Architect scalable and secure payment systems, leveraging cutting-edge technologies and best practices to deliver robust, reliable and compliant solutions.
  * Act as a Technology advisor to leadership to develop or influence applications, network, information security, database, operating systems, or web technologies for highly complex business and technical needs across multiple groups
  * Lead the strategy and resolution of highly complex and unique challenges requiring in-depth evaluation across multiple areas or the enterprise, delivering solutions that are long-term, large-scale and require vision, creativity, innovation, advanced analytical and inductive thinking
  * Translate advanced technology experience, an in-depth knowledge of the organizations tactical and strategic business objectives, the enterprise technological environment, the organization structure, and strategic technological opportunities and requirements into technical engineering solutions
  * Provide vision, direction and expertise to leadership on implementing innovative and significant business solutions
  * Maintain knowledge of industry best practices and new technologies and recommends innovations that enhance operations or provide a competitive advantage to the organization
  * Strategically engage with all levels of professionals and managers across the enterprise and serve as an expert advisor to leadership
  * Provide technical leadership and mentorship to a team of architects and engineers, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration and excellence
  * Drive continuous improvement through rigorous evaluation of existing systems and processes, recommending and implementing enhancements to optimize performance, reliability and cost efficiency

  
****Required Qualifications:****

  * 7+ years of Engineering experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education
  * 7+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: systems, applications, or architecture planning
  * 3+ years in one or a combination of: Engineering/Architecture in Payments and/or Financial Services Industry
  * 2+ years in Payments Engineering/Architecture

**Desired Qualifications:**

  * Knowledge and experience with customer payment architecture and processing including digital payments, mobile deposits, debit card, payment gateways, and overall payment processing.
  * Experience in Cloud, Data, DevSecOps, Domain Driven Design, Archimate, Architecture Frameworks (TOGAF), and Agile
  * 5+ years in payments and financial services industry experience
  * Research and Analysis including Financial Analysis
  * Architecture strategy and roadmapping
  * High communication skills to work with all levels of business and technical teams
  * Ability to partner with many different platform engineering and architecture teams on architecture that spans multiple areas
  * Ability to influence across all organizational levels, particularly senior management
  * Ability to negotiate, influence, and collaborate to build successful relationships and provide mentorship to other architects
  * Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

**Job Expectations:**

  * Ability to travel up to 20%
  * This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship

$144,400.00 - $300,000.00

title: Lead Software Engineer Cloud Observability
description:
**About this role:**

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Software Engineer to join our Technology
organization and be part of our Chief Technology Office (CTO) team. Learn more
about the career areas and business divisions at
[wellsfargojobs.com](https://www.wellsfargojobs.com/).

You will be a hands-on Cloud Observability expert and be part of our
innovation at an enterprise scale to transform Telemetry, Monitoring and
Observability for on-prem platforms, as well as private and public cloud.  Our
vision is to deliver observability capabilities to customers for consumer
grade insight at competitive price utilizing open source and open standards,
while modernizing to reduce cost of failure, improve availability, and
optimize software engineering capacity.

  
**In this role, you will:**

  * Lead complex technology initiatives including those that are companywide with broad impact

  * Act as a key participant in developing standards and companywide best practices for engineering complex and large-scale technology solutions for technology engineering disciplines

  * Design, code, test, debug, and document for projects and programs

  * Review and analyze complex, large-scale technology solutions for tactical and strategic business objectives, enterprise technological environment, and technical challenges that require in-depth evaluation of multiple factors, including intangibles or unprecedented technical factors

  * Make decisions in developing standard and companywide best practices for engineering and technology solutions requiring understanding of industry best practices and new technologies, influencing and leading technology team to meet deliverables and drive new initiatives

  * Collaborate and consult with key technical experts, senior technology team, and external industry groups to resolve complex technical issues and achieve goals

  * Maintain knowledge of industry best practices and new technologies and recommends innovations that enhance operations or provide a competitive advantage to the organization

  * Lead projects, or serve as a peer mentor

**Required Qualifications:**

  * 5+ years of Software Engineering experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education

  * 3+ years of cloud observability architecture and engineering experience with Kubernetes on Azure, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), or Amazon Web Services (AWS)

  * 3+ years of experience with at least two of the following modern programming languages: Java, Python, JavaScript, or Go 

  * 1+ year of experience in building microservices, management pack, and exporters for observability

  * 1+ year of experience in building and deploying microservices and cross channel restful Application Programming Interface (API)

  * 1+ year of experience with secure DevOps and deployment automation to cloud environments

  * 1+ year of experience in ReactJS, Spring Framework, UML, NoSQL, MariaDB, Kafka pub/sub model, ETL

  * 1+ year of experience in data analysis, data import and data feeds

**Desired Qualifications:**

  * 3+ years of Kubernetes, Prometheus, Open Telemetry, Time Series Metrics, Capacity, Big Data, Machine Learning, or Synthetics monitoring tools experience 

  * Kubernetes Cloud Native Associate (KCNA) or Certified Kubernetes Application Developer (CKAD) certifications

  * Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

  * Deep technical understanding of core concepts, memory management, multi-threading, REST based services, React and Spring/Spring Boot

  * Ability to influence and build relationships with LOB stakeholders, technology CIO leadership, external service providers, and architecture teams 

  * Experience in one or a combination of the following: Capacity Analytics, time series metrics analysis, Telemetry, Monitoring, Observability

  * Experience of modern software development lifecycle, including Test Driven Development (TDD), Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery/Deployment (CI/CD), Pairing, Build Automations, Automated Testing, Agile Games, Chaos Engineering

  * Knowledge of Agile methodologies and product operating model

  * Knowledge and understanding of application or software security such as: web application penetration testing, secure code review, secure static code analysis

  * Knowledge and understanding of technology architecture: solutions development

  * Knowledge and understanding of complex enterprise systems and frameworks including frontends, middleware, services layer, database, backend, and downstream interfaces

title: Experience Design Director - Strategy, Digital & Innovation
description:
_**Please include your portfolio on your resume or submit a PDF of your work
samples along with your application**_

At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers
at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace
diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and
inspired.

Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It
all begins with you.

The Strategy, Digital and Innovation (SDI) team forges the strategic direction
of Wells Fargo, provides and manages our digital foundation and common
capabilities, and transforms our business models to meet evolving customer
needs and grow the company. The investments we are making will help the
company create innovative digital banking experiences, and make it easier for
customers to achieve their financial goals.

**Experience Design at Wells Fargo**

We are on a mission to build the best digital experience delivering customer
joy in the financial space.

As part of the Experience design team at Wells Fargo, you will be fueled by
exceptional thought leadership, subject matter experts and world class talent.

**About the Role:**

  
This is a XD Design Director role for the Wealth and Investment Management
(WIM) team within Consumer Digital Channels. This leader will help set the
vision and direction and raise the bar for the work, leading by example and
inspiring the teams. A strong point of view on design is essential, hands on
experience, implementation of strategies in a complex ecosystem, as well as
the expertise of blending the art and the science of a well crafted
experience. This leader will be a strategic partner to our Digital Product and
Platform leaders and will work collaboratively across the Consumer practice to
ensure connectivity and best practices are being followed for Wells Fargo’s
customer base.  She/He will focus on product-based design and help build out
the needed specialization within our client experience in an agile design
model.  This leader will create frameworks, forums, and operating norms to
effectively run the business while providing leadership to drive a best in
class design organization in addition to thought leadership across our new
growth areas. She/He  will have a deep understanding of the Consumer client
base and experience running communication design and behavioral testing.

**In this role, you will:**

  * Set the vision and direction and raise the bar for the work.

  * Have a strong point of view on visual design and content design.

  * Be hands on designing UX and UI in Figma  

  * Implement strategies in a complex ecosystem, as well as the have expertise of blending the art and the science of a well-crafted experience

  * Partner directly with the Digital Product leaders for our mobile app, online banking, public site, and product sales and servicing

  * Coordinate cross channel initiatives 

  * Build and own product-driven design

  * Develop and lead a team of design professionals to execute the vision

  * Act as a senior strategy and business leader capable of working cross-functionally across all levels of the organization to execute enterprise-wide strategic programs

  * Demonstrate an ability to build out high performing teams

  * Act as a trusted and credible advisor and strategic partner to the SDI leadership team and business leaders with regard to the responsibilities of this role

**Required Qualifications:**

  * 8+ years of Website or Application Design experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education

  * 4+ years of Management experience

**Desired Qualifications:**

  * Experience in one or more of the following: digital customer experience, digital product/program management, digital platforms, or digital consulting

  * Demonstrated mastery/expertise in Product Strategy in at least three of the following: Interaction Design, Visual Design, Product Strategy, Information Architecture, Content Strategy, User Research, or Prototyping

  * Experience directing digital experiences for large financial services platforms

  * Experience leading a program of work across multiple teams through the full product development cycle (discovery, concepts, prototyping, execution)

  * Experience overseeing the output of multiple products or channels (e.g., digital/physical), preferably in multiple industries              

  * Elite storyteller and communicator with ability to quickly craft Board and OC level materials with minimal direction and iteration. Ability to consistently articulate a strong design rationale

  * Ability to connect design decisions to broader strategic and business decisions

  * Comfort presenting to all levels of seniority

  * Experience managing creative design efforts in a complex environment

  * Experience with managing agency and 3rd-party relationships a plus

  * Honed analytical skills coupled with proven problem solving capabilities

  * Past success developing frameworks for metrics, dashboards and associated reporting at the division/enterprise level

  * Comfortable with ambiguity and able to shape and drive work independently

  * Thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and can adapt and adjust to real-time shifts in priorities and work-flow

  * Proactive problem solver with a bias toward execution and a strong sense of urgency (demonstrated track record of getting things done, while building bridges, despite the obstacles in their way)

  * Proven and demonstrated leadership skills including relationship building, change leadership, partnering and collaboration skills with clear ability to influence, gain buy-in and negotiate with a diverse group of key business partners/leaders

  * Excellent written and verbal communication skills with experience presenting to senior management and ability to articulate key messages in a straightforward and understandable manner

  * Ability to energize and motivate others; thrives in teams; highly inclusive and collaborative with proven ability to lead through influence vs. authority

  * Proven success driving objectives requiring a high level of cooperation from other parts of the organization to collaborate, initiate action planning and manage change

  * A curiosity mindset: up-to-date in digital global and local trends; fluency in the strategic impacts of a changing digital and media landscape

****Job Expectations:****

  * This position is not eligible for Visa sponsorship

  * This position is a hybrid work model and will not be a telecommute position. Must be willing to work out of Charlotte, NC, New York, NY or San Francisco, CA approximately 3 days a week

**Pay Range**

$173,300.00 - $359,900.00

title: DevSecOps Lead Software Engineer
description:
**About this role:**

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Software Engineer in the Digital Technology and
Innovation group which supports evolving digital platforms and enhances
integration of the innovation pipeline into our customer-facing capabilities.

Learn more about the career areas and lines of business at wellsfargojobs.com

This position will be in the DPE(Digital Platform Engineering)-DARE(Digital
Application Release Engineering) team. DARE team provides DevSecOps services
to various partners within the DTI(Digital Technology and Innovations)
Organization. DARE team provides application support, cloud enablement and
Build & Release engineering functionalities including operations support for
applications in lower(pre-prod) environments.

**In this role, you will:**

  * Lead complex technology initiatives including those that are companywide with broad impact.

  * Act as a key participant in developing standards and companywide best practices for engineering complex and large-scale technology solutions for technology engineering disciplines.

  * Design, code, test, debug, and document for projects and programs.

  * Review and analyze complex, large-scale technology solutions for tactical and strategic business objectives, enterprise technological environment, and technical challenges that require in-depth evaluation of multiple factors, including intangibles or unprecedented technical factors.

  * Participate in day-to-day standups for platform capability build.

  * Provide SME guidance for development teams.

  * Collaborate and work very closely with the engineering strategy, platform engineering and development teams to understand the infrastructure requirements and drive all aspects of application journey to the cloud platform.

  * Research industry best practices, evaluate new technologies, develop standards and engineering best practices and recommend innovative solutions that support automation.

  * Act as an expert resource for other technical teams within DTI.

**Required Qualifications:**

  * 5+ years of Software Engineering experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education.

  * 5+ years of experience with DevSecOps practices in an enterprise environment including CI/CD pipelines and DevSecOps-focused collaboration.

  * 4+ years of build-deploy automation and configuration experience within the Linux and Unix environment.

  * 4+ years of Gradle or Maven experience.

  * 4+ years of experience troubleshooting environments across the entire architecture (i.e. applications to infrastructure).

  * 5+ years of source or version control tools experience such as GIT

  * 2 years’ experience with Data streaming frameworks and products including Apache Flink or Spark.

  * 2 years’ experience with bigdata including Hadoop features like HDFS and Yarn.

  * 2 years’ Architectural knowledge of Flink stream and batch jobs designs, implementations and tuning.

**Desired Qualifications:**

  * 3+ years of Python and Shell scripting.

  * 3 + years of experience with server administration and job creation using Jenkins Continuous Integration server.

  * 3+ years of JIRA experience.

  * 3+ years of Splunk experience.

  * CICD experience of data streaming platforms and jobs.

  * Knowledge and understanding of AppDynamics.

  * Knowledge and understanding of automation and engineering release development.

  * Experience in configuring, troubleshooting Node.js tech stack and Java Tech stack-based environments.

**Job Expectations:**

  * Work Schedule Ability to work nights, weekends, and/or holidays as needed or scheduled.

title: Technology Director - CT Platform Services Leader
description:
The Consumer Technology (CT) group executes the Wells Fargo Technology
strategy and offers a strategic technology perspective to the lines of
business we support. These LOBs include Auto; Card, Merchant Services; Home
Lending; Personal Loans and Retail Services within Consumer Lending. Our teams
provide technology solutions to the LOBs and manage the application portfolios
through the enablers of skills, stability, security, scalability, speed, and
success. A customer-focused organization that delivers the next generation of
payments capabilities; advances digital offerings; enables innovation to
develop new customer experiences and products; and enhances digital channels,
branches, contact centers, and ATM technologies.

**About this Role:**

Reporting to the Consumer Technology, Head of Platform Services, the Platform
Delivery Leader will collaborate with business CIOs to transform the existing
workforce into cross functional squads to build improved products across the
Consumer Technology Portfolio.  They will guide agile platform squads to
increase productivity and quality by learning and applying the right tools and
practices to become autonomous cross-functional teams. The Leader will
spearhead non-functional requirements to better understand how resilient our
systems are and guarantee availability of products and services.
Additionally, they will spearhead adoption and delivery of automation in-
sprint, delivering improved quality and speed through automation.

**Some of the key responsibilities will include:  **

**Collaborate with CIOs to deliver availability, speed, resiliency, and
quality outcomes:**

  * Transform the existing workforce to one that can build better products across the Consumer Technology portfolio

  * Improve availability, operational efficiency, resiliency and recovery across the 90+ apps that comprise this portfolio

  * Embed cross-functional teams (‘squads’) to deliver automation and non-functional requirements

  * Culture of ‘one team’ focused on customer outcomes delivered through modern architecture and infrastructure

  * Shatter the legacy paradigms of ‘keep the lights’ on support

  * Knowledge of Architecture and App/Dev partner space and tight collaboration across both

**Mature Agile Engineering across Consumer Technology Portfolio through
partnership with enabling teams including SRE, E &A and CTO: **

  * Cross-functional and co-located team support

  * Creating a culture committed to Site Reliability skills maturity and global engineering talent

  * Product knowledge and the ability to lead your teams to become expert knowledge holders themselves

  * Manage, measure, and enforce SRE maturity, expected Agile outcomes, automation standards, code quality and code coverage

  * Collaborate to influence and uphold Enterprise standards around Non-functional Requirements (NFR’s), API’s, Events

  * Collaborate to ensure all new and modernized applications are cloud first and built to “gold standards”

  * Innovation to improve availability in distributed, mainframe and cloud applications

**Spearhead Non-Functional Requirements to both understand how resilient our
systems are and guarantee availability of Consumer Technology Portfolio:   **

  * Define and deliver all new feature functions to include automation and non-functional requirements

  * Accountable to impose constraints via non-functional requirements on the design of the system

  * Accountable for delivery and leadership of these non-functional platform and performance engineering practices (performance, availability, resiliency, scaling, auditability, logging, monitoring, deployment automation, test automation, error handling, ‘secure from the start activities’)

**Spearhead adoption and delivery of automation and code coverage:**

  * Define and lead automation, DevOps, and risk avoidance efforts

  * Ensure code coverage for all new/modified code

  * Lead test automation implementation

**Deliver efficiency through operational maturity:**

  * Define target operating model for a data-driven organization

  * Adopt enterprise tools and standards, resulting in efficiency

  * Challenge paradigms

**Lead with Agile Engineering:**

  * Define and lead SRE squads, domain drive design practices, and support constructs such as blue/green deployment, A/B testing, feature toggles etc.

**Lead Wells Fargo in Site Reliability and Agile Engineering Talent Bench:**

  * Develop a T-shaped bench of engineering experts

  * Establish clear objectives and key results

  * Attract and grow diverse teams

  * Establish strong management functions and talent

  * Facilitate an environment for continuous technology learning and ‘fail fast’ culture

**Additional responsibilities may include:  **

  * Managing a team of engineering managers and leads

  * Focusing on delivering commitments aligned to enterprise strategic priorities

  * Building support for strategies with business and technology leader Guiding development of actionable roadmaps and plans

  * Identifying opportunities and strategies for continuous improvement of software engineering practices

  * Providing oversight to software craftsmanship, security, availability, resilience, and scalability of solutions developed by the teams or third-party providers

  * Identifying financial management and strategic resourcing

  * Setting risk management guidelines and partnering with stakeholders to implement key risk initiatives

  * Developing strategies for hiring engineering talent

  * Leading implementation of projects and encouraging engineering innovation

  * Collaborating and influencing all levels of professionals including more experienced managers

  * Leading and motivating teams to achieve objectives

  * Interfacing with external agencies, regulatory bodies or industry forums

  * Managing allocation of people and financial resources for Technology Strategic Leadership

  * Developing and guiding a culture of talent development to meet business objectives and strategy

**Required Qualifications:**

  * 8+ years of Technology Strategic Leadership experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education

  * 4+ years of Management experience

  
**Desired Qualifications:**

  * Domain experience in Platform Engineering and support, Site Reliability Engineering, Architecture, Branch Banking, and Become a Customer portfolios

  * 8+ years of experience with Agile practices

  * 5+ years of experience with systems architecture

  * Knowledge and understanding of system monitoring and automation

  * Knowledge and understanding of application testing methodologies, tools and execution

  * Ability to influence & build support for strategies across all organizational levels, particularly senior management

  * A Masters degree in computer science or engineering

  * Experience managing large technology development efforts within a major line of business Ability to communicate powerfully and prolifically with experience communicating complex technical information and value/impact in simple terms to senior and executive leaders

  * Highly skilled leadership capabilities including experience building, leading and engaging high-performing, diverse and inclusive teams

**Job Expectations:**

  * Ability to travel up to 10% of the time

  * This position offers a hybrid work schedule

  * This position is not eligible for Visa sponsorship

**Pay Range**

  * New York, NY $207,900.00 - $431,900.00 Annual

title: Lead Control Management Officer
description:
**Why Wells Fargo:**

This is where your true career begins. We ranked #3 on the 2022 LinkedIn Top
Companies list – and #1 among financial services companies – as the best
workplace “to grow your career” in the U.S. At Wells Fargo, we support
employees’ career aspirations and growth. We’re proud of our employee-welfare-
centered business approach and our commitment to diversity, equity, and
inclusion in the workplace. We offer competitive salaries and one of the
richest benefits packages in the industry. Our Total Rewards program focuses
on wellness, work-life balance and the financial health of our employees. Our
customers invest with us, we invest in you. Apply today.

At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers
at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace
diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and
inspired. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding
talent. It all begins with you.

Learn more about the career areas and lines of business at
[wellsfargojobs.com](https://www.wellsfargojobs.com/career-areas/)

**About this role:**

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Control Management Officer for its Fraud and
Claims Management Control Team. This role will play a significant role in
developing and maintaining a high-quality Risk & Control environment,
including issue management, RCSA and Policy/Compliance adherence.

  
**In this role, you will:**

  * Lead complex initiatives designed to mitigate current and emerging risks with broad impact
  * Act as key participant in monitoring, evaluating, and measuring the impact of decisions practiced in Control Management functional area
  * Monitor moderately complex business specific programs, and provide risk management consulting to support the business in designing and implementing risk-mitigation strategies
  * Monitor, measure, evaluate, and report on the impact of decisions and controls to the relevant business group or functional area
  * Develop and implement risk monitoring and risk reporting processes and controls
  * Collaborate with relevant business group to identify current and emerging risks associated with business activities and operations, and provide guidance in developing and implementing risk-mitigating strategies
  * Lead Control Management project or virtual teams

  
**Required Qualifications:**

  * 5+ years of Risk Management or Control Management experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education

  
  
**Desired Qualifications:**

  * Knowledge and understanding of Control Programs including Risk and Control Self-Assessment (RCSA) and advanced proficiency in the Issue Management lifecycle

  * Advanced knowledge of issue management policy
  * Ability to influence executive decision-making and successfully negotiate critical issue resolution
  * Experience working with senior business leaders as well as Audit, Compliance and Operational Risk partners.
  * Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively communicate, both written and verbally
  * Demonstrated decision-making and problem-solving skills
  * Detail-oriented with the ability to multi-task and meet deadlines with minimal supervision

  
**Job Expectations:**

  * Onsite presence is required 3 days a week at one of the posted locations.

  * Knowledge and understanding on Control Programs including Risk and Control Self-Assessment (RCSA), Issue Management.
  * Experience across enterprise risk management framework, including: risk identification, risk appetite and strategy, risk-related decisions, processes and controls, risk analytics governance, risk assessment and control design

title: Head of Strategy for Merchant Services
description:
Wells Fargo and Company (NYSE: WFC) is a diversified, community based
financial services company with $1.9 trillion in assets. Wells Fargo’s vision
is to satisfy our customers’ financial needs and help them succeed
financially. Founded in 1852 and headquartered in San Francisco, Wells Fargo
provides banking, investment, and mortgage products and services, as well as
consumer and commercial finance, through 4,300 branches, more than 11,000
ATMs, wellsfargo.com, and mobile banking, and has offices in 32 countries and
territories to support customers who conduct business in the global economy.
With approximately 238,000 team members, Wells Fargo serves one in three
households in the U.S. Wells Fargo.

** **

**About Strategic Digital & Innovation**

The Strategy, Digital & Innovation (SDI) team forges the strategic direction
of Wells Fargo, provides and manages our digital foundation and common
capabilities, and transforms our business models to meet evolving customer
needs and grow the company. The investments we are making will help the
company create innovative digital banking experiences, and make it easier for
customers to achieve their financial goals.

** **

**The Position  **

At Wells Fargo, our vision is to satisfy our customers’ financial needs and
help them succeed financially.  As a leader, you will help us deliver on our
vision and build lifelong relationships with our customers.  You will
demonstrate leadership through contributing to a company culture that supports
customers in achieving their financial goals, employees in developing their
careers, and communities in continuing to thrive.  In your role as a leader,
you will also demonstrate leadership by building and sustaining an inclusive
culture that values diversity and helping your team understand and be inspired
by their connections to the Vision & Values of Wells Fargo.  As part of a team
that serves one in three American households, you will play a vital role in
living our commitment to the highest ethical standards and maintaining the
valued trust of our customers and communities.

Our Head of Strategy for Merchant Services (Strategy & Planning Director)
covers job responsibilities for establishing the strategic direction of the
business that aligns to the immediate and long-term goals by assessing current
and future state and establishing the action plans to execute.

**In this role, you will:**

  * Lead the strategic planning process and development of long-range strategic plans for Small Business consistent with Wells Fargo's strategic planning process

  * Provide thought leadership to develop and implement strategic solutions to highly complex strategic and business problems

  * Manage and develop specialized teams of less experienced managers and professional individual contributors

  * Collaborate with and influence all levels of professionals, including peers and more experienced leadership

  * Partner closely with the management of Finance, Human Resources, and other functions

  * Manage allocation of people and financial resources for Strategy and Planning

  * Develop and guide a culture of talent development to meet business objectives and strategy

**Required Qualifications  **

  * 8+ years of Strategy and Planning experience or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education

  * 4+ years of experience working in Corporate Strategy roles either directly for a banking or financial institution and/or experience with a management consultancy firm working on large-scale strategic initiative projects for banking

  * 4+ years of Management experience

** **

**Desired Qualifications**

  * MBA preferred

  * Excellent consultative skills with strong ability to problem solve and identify business opportunities

  * Ability to structure, analyze, syndicate and synthesize recommendations for highly complex issues into impactful presentations to tell the story of a business 

  * Ability to lead by influence and cross-partner with senior business executives

**Job Expectations**

Candidates must be willing to work on site in one of the following locations:
Charlotte, NC (Uptown location), New York City, NY (Midtown Manhattan) or
Wilmington, DE

Pay Range for New York City, NY: $144,400 - $300,000 annual base salary. This
role is eligible for an annual discretionary bonus.

title: Senior Lead Product Manager- Deposits and Investments Products
description:
**About this role:**

Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior Lead Product Manager within Global Treasury
Management as part of Enterprise Functions. Learn more about our career areas
and business divisions at wellsfargojobs.com.

  
****In this role, you will:****

  * Act as the product manager for the wholesale deposits portfolio
  * Be responsible for pricing and margin management and driving product enhancements and innovation
  * Have oversight and actively manage risk for the portfolio
  * Develop and manage the operating model for Wells Fargo’s corporate and commercial deposits
  * Advise experienced leadership to develop or influence business plans, business requirements, direct product design and implementation for complex business and technical needs
  * Oversee overall product management and strategic focus for the most technical, complex and diverse products and services
  * Lead the strategy and resolution of complex and unique challenges requiring in-depth understanding of potential synergies, opportunities companywide
  * Deliver solutions that are long-term, large scale, and require consideration of global market dynamics, trends, regulatory impact, and risk management
  * Provide vision, direction and expertise to leadership on implementing innovative and significant business solutions that are strategically focused for diverse product lines
  * Articulate product vision, define scope, prioritize backlog, establish goals, and provide direction for teams to design, develop, and deliver technology and processes for updating, upgrading technologies and vendor relationships
  * Engage with leaders, stakeholders, subject matter experts, scrum masters, project managers and delivery team companywide
  * Serve as an adept advisor to leadership

****Required Qualifications:****

  * 7+ years of Product Management, product development, strategic planning, process management, change delivery, or agile product owner experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education

  
****Desired Qualifications:****

  * Experience in managing a deposit and investments product portfolio in the United States including a good understanding of the regulatory landscape
  * Experience in engaging at Asset & Liability Committees (ALCOs) or with Asset & Liability Management
  * Transaction banking or cash management product management experience
  * Ability to effectively partner across the organization to accomplish goals and tasks with the ability to influence and manage effectively
  * Strategic thinker
  * Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

****Job Expectations:****

title: Fixed Income Front Office ETrading Engineer
description:

Wells Fargo is seeking A highly skilled Lead Specialty Software Engineer

Specialty Software Engineer, you will be responsible for designing,
developing, and maintaining electronic trading systems, ensuring high
performance, reliability, and scalability. You will work closely with cross-
functional teams including Product owners, traders, quants, and developers to
ensure the reliability, scalability, and efficiency of our electronic trading
platform. Additionally, you will provide technical leadership, mentorship, and
guidance to junior engineers, fostering a culture of innovation and
excellence.

  
****In this role, you will:****

  * Lead complex initiatives on selected domains
  * Ensure systems are monitored to increase operational efficiency and managed to mitigate risk
  * Define opportunities to maximize resource utilization and improve processes while reducing cost
  * Lead, design, develop, test and implement applications and system components, tools and utilities, models, simulation, and analytics to manage complex business functions using sophisticated technologies
  * Resolve coding, testing and escalated platform issues of a technically challenging nature
  * Lead team to ensure compliance and risk management requirements for supported area are met and work with other stakeholders to implement key risk initiatives
  * Mentor less experienced software engineers
  * Collaborate and influence all levels of professionals including managers
  * Lead team to achieve objectives
  * Partner with production support and platform engineering teams effectively

**Required Qualifications:**

  * 5+ years of Specialty Software Engineering experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education
  * 5+ years of experience with capital markets business and processes, e.g. Fixed Income Electronic trading flows, algorithmic trading, Analytics, trade lifecycle.
  * 5+ years of experience with Architect, design, and develop, unit and stress test high performing ECN/Exchange gateways, RFQ, Pricing, AMM components that are integrated tightly to the entire electronic trading stack.
  * 5+ years of Experience handling/troubleshooting high speed market data, order routing, RFQ, RFS, Quotations, and Trades from multiple trading venues and broker-dealers.
  * 5+ years of Experience working with line of business partners, Line traders, technology teams, and Exchanges to document and troubleshoot production issues related eTrading Quoting, Inquiry, Post Trade Feeds flows and latency/Performance issues.
  * 5+ years of Experience working with E-trading business users and product team to establish and maintain a consistent test methodology and to resolve escalated issues during the testing process.
  * 5+ years of High-performance programming techniques in Java/Python/C++

**Desired Qualifications:**

  * Experienced in FIX Protocol.
  * Uses advanced knowledge of Fixed Income E-trading flows, Venue Interaction and Position/Risk management in identifying, evaluating and resolving highly complex test problems
  * Good understanding and working knowledge of core technology concepts in like networking, multi-threading, synchronization, data structures, algorithms, memory management, etc.
  * Basic knowledge and understanding of SEC, FINRA and international regulators
  * Domain expertise in Fixed Income (Rates, Spread) and FX , coupled with hands-on experience in building electronic trading platforms and/or components is a huge plus.
  * Experience working on low latency high-throughput transactional systems

**Location:**

150 E 42nd St. - New York, NY  10017

300 South Brevard - Charlotte, NC 28202

This is a Hybrid role 3 days in the office at any of the listed locations.

title: Lead Digital Insights Product Manager
description:
**About this role:**

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Digital Insights Product Manager to join SDI’s
**Commercial Banking and Corporate & Investment Banking (CB-CIB)
**organization. This individual will be responsible for creating digital
experiences for all Commercial and Corporate and Investment Banking clients.
Creates and enhances UI components for external clients enabling best-in-class
digital experiences and capabilities across multiple asset classes.

The Strategy, Digital and Innovation (SDI) team forges the strategic direction
of Wells Fargo, provides, and manages our digital foundation and common
capabilities, transforming our business models to meet evolving customer needs
and grow the company. The investments we are making will help the company
create innovative digital banking experiences and make it easier for customers
to achieve their financial goals. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all
begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

For additional information on this line of business, refer to the external
Careers Site at [www.wellsfargojobs.com](http://www.wellsfargojobs.com)

**In this role, you will:**

  * Lead the development and execution of complex digital business plans, programs and initiatives which have impact across the enterprise with broad impact
  * Act as key participant in large-scale planning
  * Review and analyze complex digital strategy for product, functionality, experience area
  * Influence digital strategy for the business line requiring in-depth evaluation of multiple factors including intangibles or unprecedented factors
  * Make decisions in digital strategy for product, functionality, experience area requiring strong understanding of the business, policies, procedures and/or compliance requirements
  * Lead a broad team of digital professionals to meet deliverables and drive new initiatives
  * Strategically collaborate and consult with peers, colleagues and mid-level to senior managers to resolve issues and achieve goals
  * Potentially lead projects, teams or serve as a peer mentor

  * 5+ years of digital product management experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education
  * Strong mix of strategic or design thinking and execution with scrum teams (i.e. Figma, JIRA or similar)
  * Leverages reporting, data, and analytics to enable insights for feature enhancement & product management (i.e. excel, pivot tables, XLOOKUP, PPT)

**Desired Qualifications:**

  * Agile mindset with experience with multiple methodologies (i.e. kanban, scrum, waterfall, etc.)
  * Focuses on capabilities needed to enable digital and customer UI in addition to daily Product responsibilities
  * Enabling data and insights for external clients to manage capital within foreign exchange, securities, and multiple investment asset classes
  * Supported applications for external Commercial, Corporate, Wealth & Investment Banking clients using web & mobile
  * Collaborates closely with UX/UI Design & Tech partners
  * Built reusable features and UI components that can work across multiple LOB's and asset classes

title: Senior Lead Content Designer - Consumer Digital Channels
description:
At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers
at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace
diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and
inspired. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding
talent. It all begins with you.

The Strategy, Digital and Innovation (SDI) team forges the strategic direction
of Wells Fargo, provides and manages our digital foundation and common
capabilities, and transforms our business models to meet evolving customer
needs and grow the company. The investments we are making will help the
company create innovative digital banking experiences and make it easier for
customers to achieve their financial goals.

As part of the Experience Design team at Wells Fargo, you will be fueled by
exceptional thought leadership, subject matter experts and world class talent.

We are on a mission to build the best digital experience by delivering
customer joy in the financial space.

**About this role:**

This is a XD Senior Lead Content Designer role for Consumer Digital Channels.

The Wells Fargo Experience Design (XD) team designs experiences that people
love and confidently engage with to improve their financial lives. We work
closely with Technology and Product Management to ensure we are problem-driven
(versus solution) and customer-first. While we have individual expertise
across product design, research, content strategy, and design operations, we
all operate as empowered leaders with strong design rationale. As a team, we
care about each other and believe in radical candor, want to have fun while we
work, and are obsessed with what’s most important to our 30+ million customers
and incorporating their voices into every decision!

The Experience Design Senior Lead Content Designer , leads content design and
user experiences across our products, contributing to overall strategy,
planning, product vision, and frameworks in partnership with Product
Management and Engineering Leadership to deliver the end-to-end experience.

  
****In this role, you will:****

  * Write compelling copy for a complicated and highly personal space – financial institution experience is not required

  * Leverage research data to build solutions that balance the needs of our users with our business goals

  * Be an excellent presenter, who can sell ideas, create coalition, and build support

  * Be an arbiter of best practices in grammar, messaging, writing, and style

  * Offer content design perspective throughout the product development process, influencing strategic decisions to improve the overall experience and ensure consistency

  
****Required Qualifications:****

  * 7+ years of Graphic or Website Design experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education

  * Think at a systems level to turn complexity into simple experiences
  * Enjoy working across lots of different functions
  * Love the practice of content design, and care about the details
  * Bring clarity to your teams through design and product best practices
  * Represent content design as a role that impacts the entire product, well beyond the words

****Job Expectations:****

  * This position is not eligible for Visa sponsorship

  * This position is a hybrid work model and will not be a telecommute position. Must be willing to work out of Charlotte, NC, New York, NY or San Francisco, CA approximately 3 days a week

**Pay Range:**

  * Charlotte, NC: $111,100 - $197,500

  * New York, NY: $133,300 - $237,100

title: Primary Markets BookBuild Lead Software Engineer
description:
Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Software Engineer specializing in Java with a
background in Capital Markets Systems.

In order to stay competitive in the Capital Markets business, CIB decided to
replace a third-party book building solution (for IG, HY, SPG, Agencies, and
Preferred) with a new inhouse build (NITE) that is reliable, fully integrated
into WF & third-party infrastructure (e.g. DirectBooks), and extensible to
additional desks

This is a position for a senior Java developer, who should have specialty
experience with Investment Banking technology, preferably in the Primary
Issuance in Capital Markets space (Debt or Equity), or secondary market
trading. Some specific expertise strongly recommended for this position is
related to commonly used providers (S&P and Direct Books) protocols (FIX,
SOAP, XML, REST/JSON) which is used by NITE application. The new person hired
for this position will code, test, and implement enhancements and technical
solutions as defined and prioritized by business unit. The person in this Lead
developer role will also have a role to play in guiding a large offshore team
which will also be contributing to the product. In addition to CTB activities
this role will provide BAU support, ensuring platform stability and
performance. The tech stack for the role is Java/Kafka/SQL

  
**In this role, you will:**

  * Lead complex technology initiatives including those that are companywide with broad impact
  * Act as a key participant in developing standards and companywide best practices for engineering complex and large-scale technology solutions for technology engineering disciplines
  * Design, code, test, debug, and document for projects and programs
  * Review and analyze complex, large-scale technology solutions for tactical and strategic business objectives, enterprise technological environment, and technical challenges that require in-depth evaluation of multiple factors, including intangibles or unprecedented technical factors
  * Make decisions in developing standard and companywide best practices for engineering and technology solutions requiring understanding of industry best practices and new technologies, influencing and leading technology team to meet deliverables and drive new initiatives
  * Collaborate and consult with key technical experts, senior technology team, and external industry groups to resolve complex technical issues and achieve goals
  * Lead projects, teams, or serve as a peer mentor

  
**Required Qualifications:**

  * 5+ years of Software Engineering experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education
  * 5 + years of Java EE / Spring experience
  * 5+ years of technical design experience
  * 5+ years of experience with full Software Development Life Cycle using Agile, Iterative and/or Waterfall methodologies
  * 5+ years hands on experience in: 
    * Cloud based software development – AWS, Azure, Tanzu/PCF
    * JDK11+, Java EE, Spring Boot, Spring Framework (data, Web, Kafka), Micro Services
    * Junit
    * Kafka or other event driven software
    * Tomcat Application Server, Netty or Weblogic
    * Maven, Gradle or any other build frameworks

**Desired Qualifications:**

  * Developing User Interface using ReactJS with Redux or Angular
  * Experience using Selenium, Qmetry or other Automation frameworks that support BDD constructs
  * Experience with FIX protocol
  * Demonstrate analytical, decision-making, and troubleshooting skills 

  
**Job Expectations:**

  * This position offers a hybrid work schedule.

**Locations:  **

300 S Brevard Street, Charlotte, NC 28202

150 E 42nd St., New York, NY  10017

**Pay Range**

$111,100.00 - $237,100.00

title: Digital Payments Marketing Strategy
description:
**About this role:**

Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior Lead Marketing Consultant to lead Digital
Payments Marketing Strategy within Consumer, Small and Business Banking (CSBB)
Marketing.

This role is part of the CSBB Digital Engagement Marketing organization,
responsible for engaging customers with our digital banking, investing, and
financial goal setting experiences. This role will help define how we position
and market our growing suite of digital payments experiences with the goal of
improving customer satisfaction, brand favorability, deepening, and retention.

Learn more about the career areas and lines of business at wellsfargojobs.com

  
**In this role, you will:**

  * Develop the overall marketing strategy to bring to market our Wells Fargo digital payments offerings, including audience analysis, targeting and channel strategy, positioning and messaging
